t: Job 16
Job Replies: Miserable Comforters Are You
Then*p Job answered and said:
“I*pn have heard many such things; miserable*ld comforters are you all.
Shall*ln windy words have an end? Or*ld what provokes you that you answer?
I*ln also could speak as you do, if*ld you were in my place; I*ln could join words together against you and*ld shake my head at you.
I*ln could strengthen you with my mouth, and*ld the solace of my lips would assuage your pain.
“If*pn I speak, my pain is not assuaged, and*ld if I forbear, how much of it leaves me?
Surely*ln now God has worn me out; he*ld has made desolate all my company.
And*ln he has shriveled me up, which*ld is a witness against me, and*ln my leanness has risen up against me; it*ld testifies to my face.
He*ln has torn me in his wrath and hated me; he*ld has gnashed his teeth at me; my*ld adversary sharpens his eyes against me.
Men*ln have gaped at me with their mouth; they*ld have struck me insolently on the cheek; they*ld mass themselves together against me.
God*ln gives me up to the ungodly and*ld casts me into the hands of the wicked.
I*ln was at ease, and he broke me apart; he*ld seized me by the neck and dashed me to pieces; he*ln set me up as his target;
his*ld archers surround me. He*ln slashes open my kidneys and does not spare; he*ld pours out my gall on the ground.
He*ln breaks me with breach upon breach; he*ld runs upon me like a warrior.
I*ln have sewed sackcloth upon my skin and*ld have laid my strength in the dust.
My*ln face is red with weeping, and*ld on my eyelids is deep darkness,
although*ln there is no violence in my hands, and*ld my prayer is pure.
“O*pn earth, cover not my blood, and*ld let my cry find no resting place.
Even*ln now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and*ld he who testifies for me is on high.
My*ln friends scorn me; my*ld eye pours out tears to God,
that*ln he would argue the case of a man with God, as*ld a son of man does with his neighbor.
For*ln when a few years have come I*ld shall go the way from which I shall not return.
